intro: Dictyodroma hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan lily, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and prefers well-drained soil. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
